references.paper_title: Medical image segmentation review: The success of u-net
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive overview of U-Net and its variants, which forms the basis for many of the modifications explored in the current study.

references.paper_title: Advances in medical image segmentation: A comprehensive review of traditional, deep learning and hybrid approaches
references.reason: This review paper offers a broad perspective on medical image segmentation, encompassing traditional and deep learning methods, setting the context for the current work's focus on deep learning techniques.

references.paper_title: U-net: Convolutional networks for biomedical image segmentation
references.reason: This seminal paper introduces the U-Net architecture, which serves as the foundation for the modifications and comparisons made in the current study.

references.paper_title: An image is worth 16x16 words: Transformers for image recognition at scale
references.reason: This work introduces the Vision Transformer (ViT), a crucial component in several U-Net modifications discussed in the study, highlighting the importance of Transformer architectures in image segmentation.

references.paper_title: Mamba: Linear-time sequence modeling with selective state spaces
references.reason: This paper introduces the Mamba architecture, another key component of some U-Net modifications studied in the paper, providing a computationally efficient alternative to Transformers.
